name: French Jazz with Jazz Plazma
description:
A touch of French from Montreal-born vocalist Suzelle, who has been living in Toronto for many years. She performs in several music bands as a vocalist.

Bassist and guitarist Rachel has spent almost five decades playing electric and upright bass in various bands.

Drummer Gaby came onto the Toronto music scene as a bass player for Demi Monde. Her drum journey started when she spied a notice for drum lessons and she hasn't looked back! 

 Keyboardist Serge established Jazz Plazma over a decade ago, focused on playing lounge jazz influenced by world music. The band is active in the GTA, performing at the local venues, festivals, corporate and public events, and is available for booking.

name: TWENTY - An Anniversary Celebration Concert Featuring Special Guest: Fefe Dobson

location.name: Meridian Arts Centre - George Weston Recital Hall

description: Join newchoir, Toronto's original rock choir, as they celebrate song, spirit and community with their milestone 20th Anniversary Celebration Concert, featuring special guest and Juno-nominated artist, Fefe Dobson. Artistic Director & Producer: Scott Pietrangelo. You will get to experience newchoir's electrifying renditions of iconic songs by legends like Elton John, Queen, Stevie Wonder, U2, Meat Loaf and Barenaked Ladies, to name just a few. newchoir's 100+ singers will also back Fefe Dobson as she performs a selection of her chart-topping hits featuring newchoir's own rock band, string quartet and a few more musical surprises.

name: Brunch with Solidaridad Tango
description: Join the Toronto Tango Community Orchestra for an afternoon of music by Astor Piazzolla and his contemporaries. Featuring a full orchestral tango sound, and guest vocal performances, this show will highlight the talents of the Toronto  community. DJ La Sonrisa will wrap up the afternoon with your favourite traditional tandas for dancing, so bring your dancing shoes and bring the kids.

name: Oil Painting Workshop
description: Capture the warmth and texture of fresh lemons, perfect for beginners and art lovers alike. Learn step-by-step techniques while creating your own colourful still life painting.

name: Humber Arboretum Trail Stewardship Event
description:
Join to help repair the natural surface trail connecting the Centre for Urban Ecology to Humber Arboretum Park.

Event site conditions vary. Contact us for more information including accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.

name: Textured Art Workshop
description: Learn our texture paste recipe and play with patterns and tools to create art you can hang on your walls. Come with a friend, or on your own. No experience needed!

name: Doors Open Toronto at the Canadian Film Centre
description:
Explore the historic Windfields Estate, home of the Canadian Film Centre, during Doors Open Toronto! Enjoy guided tours of the landmark buildings, lawn games, and short film screenings by CFC residents and alumni. Discover the estate's rich history and the legacy of renowned Canadian philanthropist and entrepreneur, E.P. Taylor.

Film screenings in the basement cinema (please note the cinema is not a physically accessible space)

Lawn games, including Giant Jenga, Basketball Shoot, and Carnival Knock Down.
Guided tours by Jacqueline Mackey (former Executive Lead, Finance, CFC) and Jo Ann Pynn (former Supervisor, Cultural Assets, City of Toronto)

name: Doors Open Toronto at Spadina Museum
description: Visit Spadina Museum for Doors Open and step back in time to Toronto in the 1920s.  Find out how adults and children alike did for fun in their leisure time.  Enjoy the beautiful gardens in full bloom!

name: Terracotta Pot Painting Workshop
description: Paint, plant, and play with creativity at this fun mini pot workshop! You'll decorate your own terracotta pots and plant herb seeds inside - leaving with something handmade, beautiful, and ready to grow.

name: Playground Tours with Architects: St. James Park Playground
description: St. James Park, one of Toronto's oldest downtown public spaces, is located in the St. Lawrence Market neighbourhood. Designed through extensive community consultation, its award-winning playground by PMA Landscape Architects and Earthscape Play features market-inspired play structures such as a three-platform slide, asparagus climbers and an ice cream cone climber. Join the Toronto Society of Architects (TSA), Earthscape Play and PMA Landscape Architects to explore the design process, from initial consultation to installation, including discussions on risky play and accessible play. This is one of three TSA-led tours at Doors Open Toronto 2025 focusing on playground design.

name: Estonian Music Week 2025: Tuulikki Bartosik x Sander Mölder, Caracol
description:
Presented in partnership with Wavelength.

Sculptors of folktronic soundscapes. 

Tuulikki Bartosik & Sander Mölder create a sound where Nordic and Baltic influences meet modern innovation. Their music is both minimalistic and rich—emotionally resonant and sophisticated, that invite listeners to a space where tradition evolves and new ideas emerge. 

Caracol (CAN)

Bilingual artist who walks her own path. Montréal-based songwriter/producer. 

This event is part of the Estonian Music Week (EMW) festival programme running May 22-25.

name: Estonian Music Week 2025: Mart Avi, Katie McBride
description:
Presented in partnership with Wavelength.

Mart Avi (EST)
Mart Avi is the twilight samurai of alternative pop, known for making spiky and mysterious music for the feet and heart, for living and loving. A consummate performer, he presents a fascinating paradox of soulful tenderness pulsing beneath commanding arm thrusts and menacing high kicks.

Katie McBride (CAN)
Award-winning singer, composer and producer Katie McBride is a builder of worlds. From the realms of experimental, electronic, ambient pop, her music crisscrosses dreamscapes and altered mental states, reaching into subterranean currents for deep truths.

This event is part of the Estonian Music Week (EMW) festival programme running May 22-25.

name: Walk to Make Cystic Fibrosis History 2025

location.name: Fort York National Historic Site, Garrison Common

description:
The Walk is CF Canada's largest fundraising event. It takes place in local communities across Canada and brings us together with one goal - taking a step toward creating a life unrestricted for all Canadians living with Cystic Fibrosis.

Donations raised from this event will fund research, advocacy, care and support that will help people with Cystic Fibrosis live longer and healthier lives. This year, we celebrate the 65th anniversary of Cystic Fibrosis Canada and all that we've accomplished together. 

On Walk Day, join your fellow walkers to unite, walk, roll or run the local Walk route and celebrate your fundraising achievements!

organizer.name: Walk the Make Cystic Fibrosis History

name: TSA Architects Talk: Spaces for Play

location.name: 1 Spadina Cres, Toronto, ON M5S 2J5, Canada

description:
Join the Toronto Society of Architects (TSA) and Doors Open Toronto for our 2025 Architects Talk as our speakers engage in a series of fast-paced presentations (20 slides shown for 20 seconds each) that explore their work encouraging play in the city. From skateboards to ice skates and playgrounds to parks, see how play is taking shape in our city (sometimes in the places you least expect) and learn more about the serious work that goes into making a playful city. The presentations will be followed by a panel discussion and Q&A where we will further explore the relationship between play and our city. How can we make whimsy and joy part of our every day?
Registration and data collection for this program is managed by the Toronto Society of Architects.

name: Doughnut Making Class
description:
Join us for our Doughnut Class!

This class is great for absolute beginners! And you will achieve all this in just one day! Wow!

In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of creating brioche doughnuts, including mixing, proofing and frying. The dough is premade for you so you can get to the satisfying doughnut rolling, cutting, and frying part. Decorate your sweet creations with a variety of toppings and glazes. Each student takes home their sweet and delicious goodies… to share or not to share.

Note: This class contains nuts. 

Please note, classes may be held in our upstairs studio which is accessible by stairs only, please email us if you need to be accommodated.

name: Yaw Attuah Live Stand-Up Comedy Album Recording
description:
Comedian, actor and writer that was a finalist in the 2017 Toronto Comedy Brawl competition and competed in comedy competitions in Brantford, Ontario and San Diego, Canada. Yaw debuted his critical and audience hit one-person show "Rhymes with Wow" at the Toronto Fringe Festival July 2018, and has completed the Second City Toronto Writer's program and the prestigious Second City Conservatory program. 

As a stand-up comedian, Yaw has performed at many well-respected clubs/venues across North America and has opened for Comedians Sam Jay, Josh Gondelman, Eliza Skinner, and more.

name: Doors Open Toronto at Gibson House
description: Visit Gibson House for Doors Open Toronto, an open invitation to explore the city's most-loved buildings and sites. This year, get ready to join in and "Get Ready to Play" inside and outside the museum.

organizer.name: Gibson House Museum - City of Toronto Museums and Heritage Services

name: Community Environment Day at Donwoods Plaza
description:
Join Councillor Burnside (Ward 16) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: ActiveGirlsTO Workout X Kimpton Saint George Hotel
description:
Join Mel, a top-rated Toronto personal trainer and founder of MELROSE Training, for a 45-minute full-body strength class. 

This low-impact, bodyweight session is designed to build strength and mobility. This session is perfect for all fitness levels, focusing on controlled movements that strengthen your body. No experience is needed for Mel's class, and all fitness levels are welcome. Meet like-minded community members and discover your strength!

Mats will be provided, and Flow will supply water bottles. Underground parking is available, access is through the laneway.

ActiveGirlTO empowers women in Toronto through fitness, wellness, and community events.

name: Ensemble U: Estonian Music Week 2025
description:
A groundbreaking concert by leading contemporary music ensemble featuring an augmented reality enhanced cosmic journey set to the music of Canadian-Estonian composer Udo Kasemets.

This concert is made possible thanks to the generous support of Alan Teder in memory of his piano and music theory teacher Udo Kasemets.

Contemporary sound & vision architects. Currently the most active and renowned contemporary music ensemble in Estonia. It has gained recognition for its ability to perform even the most demanding works without a conductor, openness to bold experimental ideas and sensitivity to sound.

This event is part of the Estonian Music Week (EMW) festival programme running May 22-25.

name: I am Scarborough - Community Arts Project at Scarborough Museum
description:
"I am Scarborough" is a community arts project that invites Scarborough residents of all ages and backgrounds to join in art workshops to explore a diverse range of art techniques, resulting in a community-engaged art installation.

Join us during Doors Open Toronto for our first public workshop as part of this exciting new project facilitated by Kseniya Tsoy!

Kseniya Tsoy is a community-engaged artist originally from Uzbekistan and a recipient of the Newcomer Arts Award from Toronto Arts Foundation.

In the community, she is best known for her whimsical collaborative public art murals and installations where community members are engaged in all stages of the creative process. Kseniya uses vibrant colours, bold minimalist shapes and uplifting messages to create whimsical and playful artwork that inspire joy.
